events.originalText: Two U.S. Army AH-64 Apache helicopters conducted a series of air-to-ground attacks in Baghdad.
events.subtitle: Boeing AH-64 Apache
events.headline: U.S. Army Apache helicopters conduct air-to-ground attacks in Baghdad

events.originalText: Hezbollah forces crossed the Israel–Lebanon border and attacked Israeli military positions while firing rockets and mortars at Israeli towns, sparking a five-week war.
events.subtitle: Hezbollah
events.headline: Hezbollah forces attack Israeli military positions, sparking five-week war

events.originalText: Hayao Miyazaki's animated film Princess Mononoke is released, becoming the highest-grossing film in Japan for a few months.
events.subtitle: Hayao Miyazaki
events.headline: Princess Mononoke released, becomes highest-grossing film in Japan

events.originalText: Rowdy fans at Comiskey Park in Chicago stormed the field during a Major League Baseball promotional event at which a crate of disco records was blown up.
events.subtitle: Comiskey Park
events.headline: Rowdy fans storm field at Comiskey Park during MLB event

events.originalText: Sixteen-year-old Pauline Reade, the first victim of serial killers Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, disappeared in Gorton, England.
events.subtitle: Moors murders
events.headline: First victim of Ian Brady and Myra Hindley disappears in Gorton, England

events.originalText: The English rock band the Rolling Stones played their first concert, at the Marquee Club in London.
events.subtitle: The Rolling Stones
events.headline: The Rolling Stones play first concert at Marquee Club in London

events.originalText: Arab–Israeli War: Israel Defense Forces officer Yitzhak Rabin signed an order to expel Palestinians from the towns of Lydda and Ramle.
events.subtitle: 1948 Arab–Israeli War
events.headline: Yitzhak Rabin orders expulsion of Palestinians from Lydda and Ramle

events.originalText: World War II: German and Soviet forces engaged each other at the Battle of Prokhorovka (tanks pictured), one of the largest tank battles in military history.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German and Soviet forces engage in Battle of Prokhorovka

events.originalText: The Soviet–Lithuanian Peace Treaty was signed, with Soviet Russia agreeing to recognize an independent Lithuania.
events.subtitle: Soviet–Lithuanian Peace Treaty
events.headline: Soviet–Lithuanian Peace Treaty signed, recognizing independent Lithuania

events.originalText: An explosion in the ammunition magazine of the Japanese battleship Kawachi resulted in the deaths of more than 600 officers and crewmen.
events.subtitle: Magazine (artillery)
events.headline: Explosion on Japanese battleship Kawachi kills over 600 officers and crewmen

events.originalText: First World War: Second Lieutenant Kléber Dupuy defeated a German attack on Fort Souville at a key moment of the Battle of Verdun.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Second Lieutenant Kléber Dupuy defeats German attack at Battle of Verdun

events.originalText: Second Balkan War: The Serbian Army began the Siege of Vidin, which they abandoned six days later when an armistice between the Serbs and Bulgarians was signed.
events.subtitle: Second Balkan War
events.headline: Serbian Army begins Siege of Vidin in Second Balkan War

events.originalText: Joseph Smith, the founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, is said to have received a revelation recommending plural marriage.
events.subtitle: Joseph Smith
events.headline: Joseph Smith receives revelation recommending plural marriage

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: A squadron of British ships of the line defeated a larger squadron of Spanish and French vessels in the Strait of Gibraltar.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: British ships defeat Spanish and French vessels in Strait of Gibraltar

events.originalText: Saint Basil's Cathedral (pictured), located in Red Square, Moscow, was consecrated.
events.subtitle: Saint Basil's Cathedral
events.headline: Saint Basil's Cathedral consecrated in Red Square, Moscow

events.originalText: Choe Bu, an official of the Joseon dynasty, returned to Korea after months of shipwrecked travel in China.
events.subtitle: Choe Bu
events.headline: Choe Bu returns to Korea after shipwrecked travel in China

events.originalText: King Æthelstan of England secured the submission of four northern rulers: Constantine II of Scotland, Hywel Dda of Deheubarth, Ealdred I of Bamburgh, and Owain ap Dyfnwal of Strathclyde.
events.subtitle: Æthelstan
events.headline: King Æthelstan secures submission of four northern rulers
